Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from two fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery krater; interior reserved; exterior: upper part glazed with reserved areas at right break and top left corner; below, band with added red band lined in white; below, upper part of animal frieze, identity of creatures uncertain, probably lion to right; inscription cut on exterior, on band above animal frieze.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi (Naukratis), Buried in sand under the west wall of Temenos.
Curator's comments: 1888,0601.709 almost certainly makes a touch join on the left, though found in the Apollo temenos (according to the Register). The shoulder seems to be in panels, therefore from a krater, probably ring-handled.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXV, no. 666)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 675, no. 345)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.539)
